recipe.name: Pork Tenderloin with Tarragon Sauce
recipe.instructions:
1. Cut whole pork tenderloin into 1-inch slices, trimming off excess fat, and dividing the entire amount into 8 equal pieces.
2. Place meat between sheets of waxed paper. Sprinkle with salt and pepper; and with side of fist, pound to flatten slightly. Brush with mustard.
3. Spray heavy skillet or frying pan with butter flavored Pam. Slowly brown meat on both sides over medium heat, cooking 5 min. on each side until pinkness disappears entirely.
4. Remove meat onto heated platter.
5. Sprinkle tarragon over bottom of pan; add beef broth and heat to boiling, whisking to scrape up brownings from bottom of pan.
6. Add half-and-half. Boil, whisking, until reduced and thickened.
7. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if desired.
8. Pour sauce over cooked meat on platter. Serve immediately.
